questions.question_text: The PRIMARY benefit of automating application testing is to:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
While automation in application testing can offer various advantages, one of the primary benefits is providing test consistency. Automated tests can be executed in a repeatable and consistent manner, ensuring that the same tests are performed under the same conditions every time. This consistency helps identify and catch defects early in the development process, reduces the likelihood of human error, and provides a reliable foundation for assessing the quality of the software. While other benefits such as reducing time and providing flexibility are important, test consistency is often considered a key advantage of test automation.

Selected Answer: B
B. provide test consistency

The primary benefit of automating application testing is to provide test consistency. Automated testing ensures that the same tests are executed in the same way every time, which helps identify issues and regressions reliably. While automation can also reduce the time to review code, provide more flexibility, and in some cases replace manual test processes for repetitive and well-defined tasks, the main advantage is the consistency and repeatability it offers in testing.

choices.A: reduce the time to review code

questions.question_text: Which of the following BEST enables an IS auditor to prioritize financial reporting spreadsheets for an end-user computing (EUC) audit?

choices.D: Reviewing spreadsheets based on file size
choices.A: Understanding the purpose of each spreadsheet
choices.C: Identifying the spreadsheets with built-in macros
choices.B: Ascertaining which spreadsheets are most frequently used

discussion.content: Understanding the purpose of each spreadsheet is crucial for prioritizing them in an end-user computing audit. This involves gaining insight into the significance of the spreadsheet in the financial reporting process, the data it handles, and its overall impact on financial reporting. By prioritizing based on the criticality and importance of each spreadsheet, the IS auditor can focus efforts on auditing the most significant and high-risk spreadsheets, ensuring that potential risks and control issues are appropriately addressed.

Selected Answer: A
A is answer.

comments.content:
A. Understanding the purpose of each spreadsheet

Understanding the purpose of each spreadsheet is crucial because it allows the auditor to assess the relevance and significance of each spreadsheet in the financial reporting process. This understanding helps the auditor identify which spreadsheets are more critical for financial reporting and may have a higher risk associated with them. By knowing the purpose, the auditor can make informed decisions about which spreadsheets should be audited first or receive more attention during the EUC audit.

While options B, C, and D can also provide useful information, they are not as comprehensive or as directly related to the significance of the spreadsheets in the financial reporting process as understanding their purpose.

discussion.content: Agree on B, know the purpose most important

choices.D: Alignment with a risk management framework

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Aligning the IT governance framework with the business strategy is crucial for its success. IT exists to support and enable the achievement of business objectives. When the IT governance framework is closely aligned with the overall business strategy, it ensures that IT activities and investments are in line with the organization's goals and priorities. This alignment helps in optimizing IT resources, improving decision-making processes, and ensuring that IT initiatives contribute effectively to the success of the business. While alignment with industry benchmarks, information security standards, and risk management frameworks are important, the overarching connection to the business strategy is fundamental.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST critical factor for the successful implementation of an IT governance framework?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Changing privileged passwords is a critical first step to mitigate the potential security risks associated with the leaked credentials. This action helps prevent unauthorized access to systems and sensitive information. After changing passwords, further investigation and analysis can be conducted, including a forensic investigation if necessary, to determine the extent of the breach, identify any additional security measures needed, and address any policy violations by the employee. While legal actions like prosecution might be considered later based on the severity and nature of the incident, the immediate focus is on securing the systems by changing passwords.
